question: Nowadays the ways people interact with each other has changed because of technology. In what ways technology affected the types of relationships people make? Has this become a positive or negative development?
text: Technology is evolving with the rapid rate and providing us with the new avenues while keeping ourselves updated with multifarious new advancements to communicate with other. There are umpteen ways by which technology has impacted the lives and relationships between different people and hence it is beneficial to us.

Technology has influenced people and their methods of developing connections among others via myriad ways. Firstly, due to the advent of mobile phones, individuals can connect with their friends and families easily by making calls from anywhere in the world. If anything happens to them, their loved ones are just one call away and they can reach them anytime. Another way of communication has emerged recently is the social media. With the development of the social media, the world is getting closer and people can easily communicate with those who are hundreds of miles away from them. For example, People use whatsapp to send greetings and blessings to their loved ones at any time irrespective of the time and location.

Technological development has become beneficial in a plethora of ways like people are getting closer and their bond has become stronger. Previously, this was not possible due to lesser means of communication. People generally send letters in case of any mishappening which take too much of time to reach their destination. Another successful evolution which improves the lives of human beings is the Internet. Now, people can do video calls at anytime and at any place due to great internet speed. They can leave the voice messages if other person is not available to take their calls.
To encapsulate, technology has proven blessing in the daily life of every individual in this world as it has become crucial aspect of their lifestyle.

error_list.error: any of various alternatives; some other
